content.question: Which of the following statements best describes the setting of the text?

choices.label: The setting of the text is syllabic throughout.
The setting of the text is melismatic throughout.
The setting of the text begins syllabic and ends melismatic.
The setting of the text begins melismatic and ends syllabic.

content.answer: The setting of the text begins syllabic and ends melismatic.

unit.text: 2: Music Fundamentals II - Minor Scales and Key Signatures, Melody, Timbre, and Texture

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in notated music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
